bibl.idno: The Philip S. Hench Walter Reed/Yellow Fever Collection [manuscript] / [collected by] Philip S. Hench ; HEALTHSCI MS-1.

bibl.title: Letter from Grace T. Hallock to Philip Showalter Hench, January 23, 1941

div1.p: Hallock informs Hench that the inaccuracies in the Walter Reed filmstrip have been corrected and that Hench will receive a copy of the film. Autographed notes by Hench are included in the letter.

div1.head: Letter from Grace T. Hallock to Philip Showalter Hench, January 23, 1941
div1.opener:
METROPOLITAN LIFE INSURANCE COMPANY
FREDERICK H. ECKER, Chairman of the Board
LEROY A. LINCOLN, President
NEW YORK CITY
January 23, 1941
WELFARE DIVISION
----
DONALD B. ARMSTRONG, M.D.
Third Vice-President
ANTHONY J. LANZA, M.D.
Assistant Medical Director
3/6/41- Acknowledged &
sent Mile Post, comic etc to
Ley & Photostat (address)
to Armstrong
Dr. Philip S. Hench
Mayo Clinic
Rochester, Minn.
Dear Dr. Hench:
div1.p:
You will remember that last fall we had some
correspondence in regard to inaccuracies in our
Walter Reed Filmstrip. I am glad to tell you that
this strip has been revised and I am having a copy
sent to you under separate cover. Dr. Armstrong
has asked me to thank you again for your cooperation
in helping us to correct the errors present in the
old version of the film.
